content: you are loved by mary dyke gauge 19 sts x 26 row in 4 10 cm in stockinette st after blocking the width of the brim stretches to 21-22 or 53-56cm materials yarn approx 125 yds 114 m in mc approx 25 - 50 yds 23 - 46 m in cc worsted wt needles u s 6 and 8 16 in circular needles u s 8 dpns stitch marker and tapestry needle finished measurements 19 wide stretches to 21-22 at brim x 8 53 -56 cm x 17 5 cm skills needed cast on bind off work in the round use of circular or dpn needles ribbing k2tog ssk duplicate st reading a chart kitchener finish instructions cast on 92 sts with a stretchy cast on such as the longtail or twisted german with smaller needles join in the round k1 p1 ribbing for 1 5 4 cm on smaller needles change to larger needles and knit every row until the hat measures 6 inches from the cast on edge set up row for decreases *k1 k2tog k18 ssk pm *repeat from* this divides the hat into 4 sections row 1 k all stitches slipping markers row 2 k1 k2tog k until last 2 sts before marker ssk sm repeat these 2 row until 52 sts remain change to dpns as the number of sts decrease or use magic loop method with a circular needle to complete the decrease row then continue knitting with only row 2 until there are only 12 sts left finish with kitchener st and weave in ends block i blocked over a balloon but you can use a bowl or plate duplicate stitch with cc using the chart below center the letters over the front of the hat kitchener stitch by suzanne bryan https //www youtube com/watch v=efhxnvfmobe duplicate stitch by very pink knits or knitting help https //www youtube com/watch v=-cfmjyaaadw
